page.title: 01Borrowby Moor
page.content: A tranquil hamlet of wild open space leading down to the sea, covered in summer by beautiful purple heather and in winter by picturesque snow drifts up to 14ft high. Borrowby is the home of the 'Cleveland Bay' horse and some are still bred here, horses and ponies feature a great deal in the daily life as all children ride and the 'Pony Club' and local Agricultural Show are highlights of summer and hunting in winter. There are few inhabitants and the men are hill Sheep farmers having large flocks of Black faced moor sheep, the exception being the farrier kept busiy in the forge all year and one small dairy herd.
